intro: Raphionacme brownii var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf raphionacme, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
